reviews.review_msg: The most disorganized and confusing class I've ever taken. Not just me complaining but everyone is complaining in the group chat. The lecture is long and dried and the TA is absolutely helpless which makes things even more confusing. There are three exams throughout the term and each requires you to write 2100 words. It's just crazy.

Kirsten was the best prof i've had in my four years at SFU. She is extremely passionate about photography and her area of research which made her lectures even more interesting. She used examples from her research as well and had a guest speaker come in. The topic was very relevant and useful and made you examine photographs more critically.
Very good class!! Love her so much. I can't wait to take another class with her.

Kirsten is such a kind and awesome teacher, she will go above and beyond to help her students out. I have never had a prof spend so much time helping.  Anyone who wrote a bad comment, clearly did not ask her for help and just complained. She does have very detailed assignments and this is not a slack course. My TA was awesome as well.

He is the slowest marker ever, he never went to lecture, and didn't seem to even understand what the class was about. If you are a student who is used to getting higher than a B+, don't take a class with him, because, as someone has already written, he seems to assign grades randomly.

I loved both the coursework and lectures. The unfavourable guy back here must be really annoying, anyhow this is a laid back prof who knows a lot about the subject matter.  Make sure you pick his brains not just for theories, but also for the methods you can use in your projects - as this is a project driven course...
Solid Prof. He seems to favour students however. He also seems to get fed up with other students easily.
great prof who brought the course topics to life through is stories
very high on himself, tries hard to make the course too difficult to get an A
